text.p: Here are highlights of stories in Romania's press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:
Business:
CAPITAL
- Romania lacks strategic local investors, the paper quotes Andrei Dimitriu, president of the Romanian Development Agency, as saying.
- Trading is on the rise on the OTC market.
CURIERUL NATIONAL
- Companies in the petrochemical sector top list of loss-making firms in Romania, the paper said.
- The state airline Tarom SA asked Indian authorities to investigate a near-collision in India last week involving Tarom and Gulf Air aircraft.
ADEVARUL
- Private farmers are affected by a chronic shortage of funds, the paper said.
EVENIMENTUL ZILEI
- Austrian analysts said foreign investments in Romania might amount to $500 million over July-December.
General:
ADEVARUL
- President Emil Constantinescu will present on Thursday a state-of-the-nation report marking 200 days since in office.
- United States President Bill Clinton will visit Romania after the NATO summit on July 6, in Madrid, the paper said.
ROMANIA LIBERA

- The paper reports on moves by former foreign minister Teodor Melescanu, to create a new party, the Alliance for Romania. Melescanu left the main opposition Party of Social Democracy (PDSR) last week together with fellow reformists.
- Emil Constantinescu will leave for a four-day visit to Japan on July 13.
-- Bucharest newsroom 40-1 3120264
